item.title: Report X-2024060176
item.description:
Report X-2024060176

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1 Mow N' Stow self propelled gas mower vertical storage package was found wet. Upon inspection found that the lawn mower was leaking due to defective tank. Inspected tank & found large amount of gasoline still inside lawn mower. Outer package didn't have any hazmat markings. 15a-Number in shipment: 1

item.title: Report X-2024051533
item.description:
Report X-2024051533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The plastic bottle of Alligare Diquat Herbicide leaked from a loose cap causing the shipping box to get wet. There was another bottles of Cutrine Plus inside the shipping box and it got wet and stained. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. The cap had a plastic lock. The shipper should have used inner packaging materials.

item.description:

  • Description: Package was found with closures torn open. Upon inspection found 1 plastic pail of In the Swim 3-inch tablets 50-lbs had lid coming off of pail. Package is a undeclared hazmat due to plastic pail inside box display a limited quantity diamond while the outer packaging doesn't display any hazmat markings.

item.title: Report X-2024051215
item.description:
Report X-2024051215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 17th a package was discovered while loading onto the delivery vehicle. It had a heavy chemical smell but there were no markings on the outside shrink wrap to indicate that it contained DG. The AsTRA label did not indicate DG and there was no Shippers DGD. The shrinkwrap was opened to discover 4 bags of 1334, Naphthalene Refined, 4.1 with all DG markings on the package. The shipment has been held at the station pending disposition.
